messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Unschooling didn't blossom  until I stepped aw...
messages.msgSnippet: Try Intra-Library Loan?  If your library doesn t have it, they can borrow from other libraries in the country. C.
messages.messageBody:
Try "Intra-Library Loan?" If your library doesn't have it, they can borrow
from other libraries in the country.

C.

>Sandra, is that an old book? I have tried ordering it from the library but
>they don't stock it. And I tried ordering it from the bookshop months ago
>but they said they would have to import it and I still haven't heard back
>from them.
>=======================
>
>It probably is. I'm sorry. So never mind that one.
>
>Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Unschooling didn't blossom until I stepped aw...
messages.msgSnippet: ... but they don t stock it. And I tried ordering it from the  bookshop months ago  but they said they would have to import it and I  still haven t heard back
messages.messageBody:
> > Sandra, is that an old book? I have tried ordering it from the library
but they don't stock it. And I tried ordering it from the bookshop months
ago but they said they would have to import it and I still haven't heard
back from them.

I'm not sure where you live, but have you tried talking to the reference
librarian? In our state there are two seperate systems available outside
of our local library co-op. One is a system that you can use to request a
book from any library in the state, and the other is throughout the nation.
The national service can only be accessed using the reference librarian.
It's worth a shot...

Tina

I live in Western Australia. But it's okay--I bought it.

Julie

I'm not sure where you live, but have you tried talking to the
reference librarian? In our state there are two seperate systems
available outside of our local library co-op. One is a system that
you can use to request a book from any library in the state, and the
other is throughout the nation. The national service can only be
accessed using the reference librarian. It's worth a shot...

Tina

from them.
=======================

It probably is. I'm sorry. So never mind that one.

Sandra
